snippet.textDisplay:
The way anthem now is better than what is was at launch, granted if it released in it's current state it would still get a lot of flak. Reminds me of when Destiny first released and all its content amounted to either PvP or it's one raid. Honestly games like this need mission VARIETY. If I was in charge anthem I'd have players fight waves of titans trying to attack fort retarded, instead of bumping into just a single titan or a couple titans in freeplay.
If anthem had more loot, more things to do other than seasonal events (nobody plays strongholds), and a better sculpted story with impactful dialogue options, maybe just maybe anthem will be redeemed. Its gonna take deal with the devil for them to pull anthem from the fire, it's already ashes at this point.

snippet.textDisplay: I actually jumped back into the game a few weeks ago for shits and giggles on Xbox and while the activity isn't what it was at launch I wouldn't consider this a dead game. I've been playing it for about four hours each day and have never had an empty lobby. The launch bay is also always full with players too. The discord is also very active and always has new players asking for tips and javelin builds across all platforms. It might not be a massive player base like the one Destiny has but  there is still a pretty loyal fanbase playing constantly.
snippet.textOriginal: I actually jumped back into the game a few weeks ago for shits and giggles on Xbox and while the activity isn't what it was at launch I wouldn't consider this a dead game. I've been playing it for about four hours each day and have never had an empty lobby. The launch bay is also always full with players too. The discord is also very active and always has new players asking for tips and javelin builds across all platforms. It might not be a massive player base like the one Destiny has but  there is still a pretty loyal fanbase playing constantly.

snippet.textDisplay: Will it matter? No. The vocal community will continue to talk trash. I mean whatever happened to just playing a different game? I absolutely hate all the Final Fantasies, I don't get on social media, tag the devs, or create hate threads just to get attention. I go play other games. I actually really liked Anthem and Fallout 76 but had to quit playing cuz I got sick of getting hate mags on my Xbox just because I was playing them. I don't dislike the game in any way. I hate ppl using entertainment to gain attention. I hate ppl who throw money around just so they can msg the people in the game playing. Numbers didn't just drop cuz of the game, they dropped cuz ppl got tired of being harassed by hateful ppl.

snippet.textDisplay:
Well I’ve played anthem at launch, played through the campaign and had a lot of fun playing it coop with a friend. But playing something coop is always more fun... I still think the game got more hate than it deserved, I noticed more bugs playing The Division 2 and that game was absolutely fucking boring! Anthem was 10 times better. But there was a massive lack of endgame contend and that’s wy I left it in the end. When the catalyst thing came out I restarted it but I was so overwhelmed by the Interface and the controls, I didn’t even know wtf to do... Maybe because I played Destiny 2 so much and was used to that interface and mechanics...
Idk, if they add stuff FOR FREE I’d give it another shot, I actually hope it turns out good, cause I... yea that may sound crazy... I had fun playing this...
snippet.textOriginal:
Well I’ve played anthem at launch, played through the campaign and had a lot of fun playing it coop with a friend. But playing something coop is always more fun... But there was a massive lack of endgame contend and that’s wy I left it in the end. When the catalyst thing came out I restarted it but I was so overwhelmed by the Interface and the controls, I didn’t even know wtf to do... Maybe because I played Destiny 2 so much and was used to that interface and mechanics...
Idk, if they add stuff FOR FREE I’d give it another shot, I actually hope it turns out good, cause I... yea that may sound crazy... I had fun playing this...

snippet.textDisplay: Here's the thing. I spent like 80 bux on this since I'm Canadian, I gave up on anthem a long time ago, HOWEVER... if they remake the game, and i'm allowed to play for free, and the monetization isn't disgusting since it was a buy to play game, then I'd give it another shot, I don't see why not, I already lost my money. If they try charging more or come at us with another aggressive monetization model then its done and biowares just another corporate garbage company. Armor pieces and weapons dropping as loot like.. diablo 2 style or whatever would be exaclty what i want from that game, not some shitty heres a small loot pool of crappy weapons and pay us real money for cool looking skins.
snippet.textOriginal: Here's the thing. I spent like 80 bux on this since I'm Canadian, I gave up on anthem a long time ago, HOWEVER... if they remake the game, and i'm allowed to play for free, and the monetization isn't disgusting since it was a buy to play game, then I'd give it another shot, I don't see why not, I already lost my money. snippet.textDisplay:
I still argue the base combat and classes were pretty good to great in that game.

Each javelin felt/played completely different something Destiny/Division didn’t have. And the vertical element in combat was a great add to.

It fell down terribly on content, loot, and overall gameplay loop. It was kind of like having a shiny new sports car and having no where to drive it.

Also the whole world/story concept was pretty terrible.
snippet.textOriginal:

Each javelin felt/played completely  different something Destiny/Division didn’t have.  And the vertical  element in combat was a great add to.

It fell down terribly on content, loot, and overall gameplay loop.   It was kind of like having a shiny new sports car and having no where to drive it.

Also the whole world/story concept was pretty terrible.

snippet.textDisplay: Calling Anthem 2.0 the equivalent of ActiBlizz's Warcraft 3: Reforged is not accurate enough. Anthem was not and is not a polished product compared to what former Blizzard Entertainment's Warcraft 3: Reign of Chaos was - but mostly isn't anymore, thanks to the Refunded fuckup and revised policies. Anthem never met the expectations and didn't deliver what they needed to in order to meet the demand they manipulated. WC3:ROC did deliver, but now lay dying in the battlefield due friendly-fire and there seems to be no healer present to act according to their role in the party... *facepalm
snippet.textOriginal: Calling Anthem 2.0 the equivalent of ActiBlizz's Warcraft 3: Reforged is not accurate enough. Anthem was not and is not a polished product compared to what former Blizzard Entertainment's Warcraft 3: Reign of Chaos was - but mostly isn't anymore, thanks to the Refunded fuckup and revised policies. Anthem never met the expectations and didn't deliver what they needed to in order to meet the demand they manipulated. WC3:ROC did deliver, but now lay dying in the battlefield due friendly-fire and there seems to be no healer present to act according to their role in the party... _*facepalm_

snippet.textDisplay: if they can add striders as real useful places and bases, fix all the loot, make the numbers on the items actually mean something, add more activities and raids, they could save this game. doing a big relaunch will bring some old players back, and it will attract new players. the game was very very fun to play, each javelin was different, and the gear was interesting but too shallow. this was a beta test, and if this had been beta tested at this level and then improved for another year, it would have been a hit.
snippet.textOriginal: if they can add striders as real useful places and bases, fix all the loot, make the numbers on the items actually mean something, add more activities and raids, they could save this game. doing a big relaunch will bring some old players back, and it will attract new players. the game was very very fun to play, each javelin was different, and the gear was interesting but too shallow. this was a beta test, and if this had been beta tested at this level and then improved for another year, it would have been a hit.

snippet.textDisplay: This is what happens when you put the marketing assholes in charge of game development. Every single time the devs, who are usually gamers themselves were in control the result has been "pretty good" at worst. The shills making the decisions at EA now aren't interested in delivering a game to be proud of, they're only interested in how quickly the "new product" will make them enough money for a third gold-plated yacht. This is why I stick to indies 95% of the time. I want my money to go to the people MAKING THE GAME.
snippet.textOriginal: This is what happens when you put the marketing assholes in charge of game development. snippet.textDisplay: Bioware can go to hell.   They betrayed their fanbase with the bait-and-switch of Mass Effect Andromeda, in order to produce this crapfest of a game.  Anthem was even more of a betrayal and fiasco, stealing the resources and talent from Mass Effect in order to create a dedicated games-as-service cash-cow that has utterly FAILED.  I am done with them.  There's not even an apology in this press release.  It's just spin and corporate band-aid.  I will throw money at Bethesda and Fallout 76 before I touch Bioware again.
snippet.textOriginal: Bioware can go to hell.   They betrayed their fanbase with the bait-and-switch of Mass Effect Andromeda, in order to produce this crapfest of a game.  Anthem was even more of a betrayal and fiasco, stealing the resources and talent from Mass Effect in order to create a dedicated games-as-service cash-cow that has utterly FAILED.  I am done with them.  There's not even an apology in this press release.  It's just spin and corporate band-aid.  I will throw money at Bethesda and Fallout 76 before I touch Bioware again.

snippet.textDisplay:
Make it unapologetically a next-gen game FFS taking advantages it was a Win 10 min req game that was a top 10 selling game despite how mixed it was:

- DX12/Vulkan (minimum req was Win 10); add ray-tracing being a gimmie for this game’s mechs & vistas

- 12GB RAM (aligned with next gen consoles -32GB required

- Optimized and recommended to use SSD

- Progress synced on ALL platforms you play the game on

- Ugoth oriented endgame + completely new regions & mission types exclusive to end game.

- Revamped story missions + new Dark Souls like expansion of new theses to main story line

- Revamped gun feedback

- More involves melee with new checks & balances by enemies (counters, grappling by enemies that can KO Javelins without team assistance, etc)

- Redesigned store to have majority of material launched over time purchasable at any time (sort of like League of Legends); it’s fine to have seasonal or special items purchasable with specific currency (again like League of Legends tokens/prestige)
snippet.textOriginal:
Make it unapologetically a next-gen game FFS taking advantages it was a Win 10 min req game that was a top 10 selling game despite how mixed it was:

- DX12/Vulkan (minimum req was Win 10); add ray-tracing being a gimmie for this game’s mechs & vistas

- 12GB RAM (aligned with next gen consoles -32GB required

- Optimized and recommended to use SSD

- Progress synced on ALL platforms you play the game on 

- Ugoth oriented endgame  + completely new regions & mission types  exclusive to end game. 

- Revamped story missions + new Dark Souls like expansion of new theses to main story line 

- Revamped gun feedback

- More involves melee with new checks & balances by enemies (counters, grappling by enemies that can KO Javelins without team assistance, etc)

- Redesigned store to have majority of material launched over time purchasable at any time (sort of like League of Legends); it’s fine to have seasonal or special items purchasable with specific  currency (again like League of Legends tokens/prestige)

snippet.textDisplay: i recently started playing FF14 and there is no way they have the talent or drive at bioware to pull off anything close to FF14. snippet.textDisplay: I'm one of those people who did actually go back to Anthem recently, and I have been enjoying it.  There are fewer loading screens that don't take nearly as long.  I have not had any server crashes since coming back so far.  I still wish there were more than 3 or 4 strongholds to play, but freeplay is a nice way to kill some time.  Honestly I feel like it's not a bad buy for the prices you can find it at now, if your in between games.  I'm not going to let myself succumb to the hype like I have in the past, but I am interested to see what 2.0 brings.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm one of those people who did actually go back to Anthem recently, and I have been enjoying it.  There are fewer loading screens that don't take nearly as long.  I have not had any server crashes since coming back so far.  I still wish there were more than 3 or 4 strongholds to play, but freeplay is a nice way to kill some time.  Honestly I feel like it's not a bad buy for the prices you can find it at now, if your in between games.  I'm not going to let myself succumb to the hype like I have in the past, but I am interested to see what 2.0 brings.

snippet.textDisplay: Anthem isn't completely dead I play pretty regularly with friends once or twice a week. Combat and flying is still fun. The loot drops are better. They've added a little bit of content here and there like new events and weapons, but not as much as they should have. It isn't completely dead but it's not great. Obviously needs a lot of work and content still. Really hope they can deliver, the game has a lot of potential, we'll just have to wait and see if they can fix it right.
snippet.textOriginal: Anthem isn't completely dead I play pretty regularly with friends once or twice a week. Combat and flying is still fun. The loot drops are better. They've added a little bit of content here and there like new events and weapons, but not as much as they should have. It isn't completely dead but it's not great. Obviously needs a lot of work and content still. Really hope they can deliver, the game has a lot of potential, we'll just have to wait and see if they can fix it right.

snippet.textDisplay: All of this are great but dont FORGET ME 3 is an older game simply. ME A is a very good game it really is and i wont go in to that much detail cause its Just a matter of opinion and taste and that's not the point. Simly Andromeda was not a Mass effect game imho and i was one of few People that i didn't even notice the bad facial animation what i noticed from the begining was that the characters, story, fanctions, vilains, and even teammates and allies where absolutely boring and i didn't care much if they live or die generally the story and script was bad imho and that can not be patched. The ME trilogy did all that perfect imho and at the same time the games got better as they where released in comdat content visuals and sound. Yes they had issues but at the same time they created one of most iconic story and character based games in the game industry and i would love to see that continue with the potential that next gen graphics and consoles and technology gives to the gaming industry. Andromeda had that and didn't deliver what was expected.
snippet.textOriginal: All of this are great but dont FORGET ME 3 is an older game simply. ME A is a very good game it really is and i wont go in to that much detail cause its Just a matter of opinion and taste and that's not the point. Simly Andromeda was not a Mass effect game imho and i was one of few People that i didn't even notice the bad facial animation what i noticed from the begining was that the characters, story, fanctions, vilains, and even teammates and allies where absolutely boring and i didn't care much if they live or die generally the story and script was bad imho and that can not be patched. The ME trilogy did all that perfect imho and at the same time the games got better as they where released in comdat content visuals and sound. Yes they had issues but at the same time they created one of most iconic story and character based games in the game industry and i would love to see that continue with the potential that next gen graphics and consoles and technology gives to the gaming industry. Andromeda had that and didn't deliver what was expected.

snippet.textDisplay:
TL;DR: Top tip, be patient with purchasing any video game, especially service based ones. If you truly want to boycott these shady development strategies, just pay for a game at it’s discounted price later when it’s nearly finally reached it’s full price quality. Get in the groove of playing last years blockbusters today, while this years failures work on becoming masterpieces next year. That way, you always play sick games. Trust me, tried and tested method. 100% satisfaction with most games especially at the price I pay.

I’ve had so much fun playing games like Destiny, The Division and Anthem, but this is because I always bought them 1 year after release, when they are at the peak of their potential, AND at their lowest price.

Destiny 1 TTK, Destiny 2 Forsaken, The Division Survival, and now Anthem 2.0. Destiny 1 and 2 were both free and the expansion updates were ~£20 each. The Division 1 & 2, ~£25 each. Anthem, free with EA access, £4 per month.

Condition yourself to believe any day 1 release of a “service based game” as the actual beta test, but actually though. Just don’t buy them. Tbh I don’t think i’ve ever bought ANY game for over £50. I wouldn’t even buy The Last of Us 2 full price; PS5 is coming out so obviously the “definitive edition” cashgrab will be out literally 6 months after day 1 release, be cheaper, and way more optimised, it’s just a fact.

When trailers come out I always think “yeah right”, with no excitement. When they’re released I think “yeah cool”, and ignore most reviews since they are almost always reflections of the game being a rip off. And a year later when the devs have understood the playerbase and what they are actually trying to achieve, I think “yeah awesome, let’s give it a spin”, and I end up spending the next 3 months playing solely that game.

The only problem with this is the publishers need the audience to fall for the bullshit in order to get the money to improve their games. But truth be told, in this landscape, the patient gamer is the one more often entertained. It’s a shame there’s too few of us because I’ve joined some seriously dedicated and fun communities playing service based games long after release. Anthem is actually really cool for me so far, and i’m stoked to see what 2.0 brings to players like me who they never enticed the first time when the game simply wasn’t worth it.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly I think everyone needs to lay off the hate. At least a large studio has recognized that there are serious faults and have gone in to perform a major rework on their product. But instead of being happy about that fact, people are just excited to be shitting on the studio again for the same reasons that brought about the rework. With all the bullshit going around the triple A space right now it makes me sad to see nobody relieved about positive action.
snippet.textOriginal: Honestly I think everyone needs to lay off the hate. snippet.textDisplay: As someone who reloads Anthem every time I get news of updates through Discord, it’s stability HAS improved, loading has lessened and we have gotten some new content. snippet.textDisplay: I got my anthem for free so I didn't get hit by this massive surprise failure lol. But yeah it is improved since launch. There have been numerous quality of life changes like being able to break down multiple items at once. Loading screens don't seem as much as in the launch day although some times when you load in to a mission it can take quite a while but there seems to be lesser load screens since launch day from the looks of old youtube videos. I can't speak professionally on the gear drop systems since I am always getting side tracked though.
